newsitem.title: USA: Smith Corona names Driscoll pres/CEO.
newsitem.headline: Smith Corona names Driscoll pres/CEO.

text.p: Smith Corona Corp said Wednesday W. Michael Driscoll will assume the role of president and chief executive office when it emerges from bankruptcy.
Smith Corona filed Chapter 11 bankruptcy in July 1995.
Subject to bankruptcy court approval, Driscoll will serve as a consultant to Smith Corona until the bankruptcy reorganization is completed, the company said.
Driscoll will replace Ronald Stengel, who joined the word processor and typewriter manufacturer in July 1995 to lead it through its reorganization.

Driscoll returns to Smith Corona after a brief absence. Driscoll previously served as Smith Corona's senior vice president of operations, but left in 1995 to become chief executive of I.P.C. Technologies Inc, the company said.
Driscoll's career at Smith Corona spans a 23-year history, which includes positions in finance, manufacturing and engineering, the company said.
